metadata.titel_preek: Silver and Gold on the Last Day

primair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: God intervenes in human history to judge wickedness and establish His kingdom, liberating His people from the power of Mammon.

subject.identificatie: God / Jesus Christ (The Judge/The Coming One)
tekstueel_bewijs: the One who does the reckoning is Jesus Christ
God will arrive to set things right once and for all
He will touch your heart... with a blaze of righteousness

object.identificatie: The Restoration of All Things / The Joy of the Master
tekstueel_bewijs: everything that we will ever need for the life of the age to come

zender.identificatie: The Triune God (The Alpha and Omega)

ontvanger.identificatie: The Church / The Hearer / The World
tekstueel_bewijs: we will have received as a gift everything that we will ever need

helper.identificatie: Holy Scripture / The Liturgy / The Spirit (implied in the 'touching of the heart')
tekstueel_bewijs: the lens of Holy Scripture pulls all the way back

tegenstander.identificatie: Sin, Death, and the Power of Money (Mammon)
tekstueel_bewijs: sickness unto death that afflicts the entire human race
forces too strong for mere human nature
tegenstander.toelichting_ernst: The opponent is not just bad habits but a 'sickness unto death' and 'forces too strong' for humans to overcome.

secundair_narratief_programma.beschrijving: The believer uses money as a witness to the coming kingdom.
secundair_narratief_programma.subject: The Believer / The Church
secundair_narratief_programma.toelichting_verhouding: The secondary program (ethics) is presented as a 'practice' or 'witness' to the primary program (God's judgment).

voorbeelden_god_subject: God will arrive to set things right
He will overthrow the pride of the smug
the Lord is coming... to judge
voorbeelden_mens_subject: we bear witness to our allegiance
we practice taking the long view

voorbeelden: how do we handle our money in such a way...
we will be so excited about the return
the lens of Holy Scripture pulls all the way back
incapable of rescuing itself from forces too strong

modale_analyse.modale_interpretatie: The sermon emphasizes human inability (non-pouvoir) and God's sovereign power (pouvoir) to act.

primaire_tegenstelling.niet_s2: Indifference ('The Lord will not do good nor ill')

semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.beweging_in_preek: Moves from Indifference (~S2) to the reality of Judgment (S2), then to the liberation of Grace (S1).
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.theologische_resolutie: Judgment is the 'best possible news' because it destroys the Opponent (Sin/Mammon) that enslaves the Receiver.
semiotisch_vierkant_analyse.ernst_van_s2: Very high; the 'dreadful day' is fully recovered.

diagnostische_evaluatie.classificatie_toelichting: Despite being a 'stewardship sermon,' the actantial subject remains God. Human action is framed as a response to a cosmic reality already in motion.

indicatoren_moralisme.tekstueel_bewijs: The more responsible among such groups... set a remarkable example

indicatoren_genade.indicator: God as Subject of the active verbs of salvation
indicatoren_genade.tekstueel_bewijs: He will touch your heart... with a blaze of righteousness
forces too strong for mere human nature

exemplarisme_check.beschrijving: Biblical figures are not used as moral templates; the 'servants' in the parable are interpreted through the lens of God's investment in us.
exemplarisme_check.alternatieve_lezing: Theocentric: God is the investor; the return is His work in us.

identificatie_patroon.effect_op_hoorder: Liberation from the anxiety of self-preservation.
identificatie_patroon.theologische_implicatie: Monergistic sanctification (God acts, man is liberated).

narratieve_coherentie.coherentie_beschrijving: The ethical call to give money is perfectly nested within the eschatological reality of God's judgment.

soteriologie.tekstueel_bewijs: He will overthrow the pride of the smug... end war forever.

pneumatologie.competentie_schenking: Endowment: God gives the 'gift' of everything needed.

aanbevelingen.actantiele_audit_samenvatting: The sermon successfully maintains God as the Subject of the primary narrative while positioning the hearer as a liberated Receiver.

modale_balans.huidige_onbalans: Slightly high on Savoir (the wide-angle lens metaphor).
modale_balans.concrete_suggestie: The transition from 'knowing' the judgment to 'being changed' by it is well handled.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: This is a masterclass in theocentric preaching. It addresses a moral topic (money) without falling into moralism by keeping the actantial focus on God's eschatological action.

comparatiele_analyse.verschil_met_retorische_analyse: While rhetoric would focus on the 'wide-angle lens' metaphor, semiotics reveals that the lens is a 'Helper' for the 'Subject' (God) to reveal the 'Object' (Kingdom).
comparatiele_analyse.verschil_met_exegese: Exegesis might focus on the historical context of Zephaniah; semiotics shows how the text functions as a 'Sender' of values to the modern 'Receiver'.
comparatiele_analyse.unieke_inzichten_greimas: Greimas' model exposes that the 'stewardship' is not the primary story, but a secondary program dependent on the primary 'God-as-Judge' narrative.

appendices.notities: The sermon uses the 'Rutledge Rule' perfectly, ensuring God is the subject of the most critical verbs.
